Date:«Date_»


Name: «Employee_Name»

Email: «E_Mail_ID  Personal  Official_»


RE: APPOINTMENT LETTER


Dear «Employee_Name»


We are pleased to offer you employment with Hocco Industries Private Limited subject to the following terms and conditions.

  1. Term. You are currently being appointed on a full-time basis with effect from «Date_». You will be on probation for a period of 06 months or as further extended at the sole discretion of the organization.


  2. Position, Reporting Relationship  and Responsibilities. You will be working with us in the position of

    «Designation». Your employment start date will be «Date_». Your duties and responsibilities shall be detailed out in the Employment agreement, appended herewith and the Company also reserves the right to make reasonable changes to your duties and responsibilities as the Management considers appropriate.


  3. Remuneration and Benefits. Details of your salary break up with components as per Enclosure 1 attached herewith.


  4. Code of Conduct. You agree to be bound by and faithfully observe and abide by the Company’s Code of Conduct (including, but not limited to, any office procedural manuals and any confidentiality of information policies or procedures) which are in effect from time to time which are brought to your notice or of which you should be aware. While a breach of any of the rules or regulations of the Company may be cause for discipline up to and including discharge. You should be aware that protection of the Company’s confidential information is extremely important to the success of the Company and, consequently, any breach of the confidentiality of information policies or procedures which are in effect from time to time will be cause for severe discipline and/or termination of employment for cause.


  5. Leave and Holidays. You will also be governed by the policies of the Company’s Code of Conduct with respect to leaves and holidays.


  6. You acknowledge and agree that the offered employment with our Company is based on your personal skills and experience, and not due to your knowledge of any confidential, proprietary or trade secret information of a prior or current employer. You hereby give undertaking that during your employment with our Company you will not share, take copies whatsoever of any drawings plans, specifications, reports or written statements either prepared by you or by any other person during your prior or current employment and will not disclose, divulge or communicate to any person/employee in our organization, any information of secret or confidential nature relating to trade or business of or your previous company, failing which appropriate action will be taken, including termination of your services from our Company.

In addition, to the terms of appointment mentioned above, you are also governed by the standard employment terms of the company, which are attached along with this letter (“Employment Agreement”) as Enclosure 2. The terms contained in this letter along with Company’s code of conduct and the terms of the Employment Agreement, shall constitute the rules and regulations of your employment and you are required to read the foregoing documents in conjunction. You acknowledge that you have read and understood the contents of this letter along with its enclosures. You acknowledge that you have had an opportunity to obtain independent legal advice with respect to it. You acknowledge that you have received a copy of this Agreement.

This Offer of Employment will remain open for acceptance until «Date_».


Wishing you the very best in your assignment with us and as a token of your understanding and accepting of the standard terms of employment, you are requested to sign the duplicate copy of this letter and return to us within a day.

With warm regards,



Mr. Japesh Jayadhevan Chief Executive Officer Authorized Signatory

For and on behalf of Hocco Industries Private Limited.

Name: Japesh Jayadhevan Position: Chief Executive Officer


I, «Employee_Name», hereby accept and agree to the Appointment Letter dated «Date_».


Sign

ENCLOSURE 2 EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT

This EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT (“this Agreement”) is made and entered into on this «Date_»(“Execution Date”) and to come into effect on this «Date_» (“Effective Date”)


by and between

Hocco Industries Private Limited, a Company incorporated with the Registrar of Companies, having its registered office at 12th-13th Floor, Elanza Vertex, Sindhu Bhavan Marg, Bodakdev, Ahmedabad – 380059, hereinafter referred to as "Company”,


AND

«Employee_Name», r/o «Residential_Address», hereinafter referred to as "Employee". The parties recite that:

  1. The company is engaged in the business of Manufacturing and selling a variety of Ice Creams.


  2. Employee is willing to be employed by Company, and Company is willing to employ the employee, on the terms and conditions hereinafter mentioned.

    For the reasons mentioned above, and in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises of the parties hereto, Company and the employee covenant and agree as follows:

    1. AGREEMENT TO EMPLOY AND BE EMPLOYED


      1. The Company hereby employs the Employee as «Designation» and the Employee agrees to be employed by the Company for the business purpose as defined herein below. It is specifically understood by the Employee that during term of the employment, the Employee shall neither seek nor accept to be employed, engaged, hired by or in any manner whatsoever, render services to any third party either in India or abroad whether on deputation or otherwise. This obligation shall be binding on the Employee whether the said third party is engaged in similar business as the Company or otherwise.


      2. Employee agrees that his/her appointment is being made on the basis of the particulars such as qualifications, past experiences etc. as given in the application for employment and in case any information, as given by the Employee is found false or incorrect, your appointment will be deemed void and liable for termination without notice.


      3. During the period of employment, the Employee agrees that he/she shall also be would be governed by the rules and regulations of employment of the company provided in Company’s Code of Conduct/HR Manual, that may be in force and which may be amended, altered, or annulled from time to time of the company in relation to

        conduct, discipline, and any other matters. These rules and regulations provided under the Company’s Code of Conduct/HR Manual shall be read as part of this agreement of employment.


    2. TERM. The employment of the Employee shall commence with effect from the date hereof i.e.«Date_» and continue for an indefinite term until terminated in accordance with the provisions of this agreement.


    3. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


      1. The Employee shall be employed in the capacity of «Designation», the current duties and responsibilities defined under Exhibit 1 attached to this agreement.


      2. Subject to the supervision and pursuant to the orders, advice, and direction of the Company, the Employee shall perform such duties as are customarily performed by one holding such position in other businesses or enterprises of the same or similar nature as that engaged in by the Company. The Employee shall additionally render such other and unrelated services and duties as may be assigned to him from time to time by Company including but not limited to the following:


        1. To devote substantially all of his business time and attention, his best efforts, and all his skill and ability to promote the interests of the Company,

        2. To carry out his duties in a competent and professional manner and serve the Company faithfully and diligently

        3. To work with other employees of the Company and its subsidiaries and affiliates in a competent and professional manner.


      3. The duties and responsibilities may be amended from time to time as per the sole discretion of the Company, subject to formal notification of the same being provided to the Employee and any such changes will not affect or change any other terms and conditions detailed in this Agreement.


    4. MANNER OF PERFORMANCE OF EMPLOYEE'S DUTIES. The Employee shall at all times faithfully, diligently, and to the best of his ability, experience, and talent, perform all duties that may be required of and from him pursuant to the express and implicit terms hereof, to the reasonable satisfaction of the Company. Such duties shall be rendered at the above-mentioned premises and at such other place or places as the Company shall, in good faith, require or as the interests, needs, business, and opportunities of the Company shall require or make advisable.


    5. PROBATION

      1. The parties hereto agree that the initial Six (06) month period of this agreement is "probationary" in the following respects:

        1. the Company shall have an opportunity to assess the performance, attitude, skills and other employment-related attributes and characteristics of the Employee;

        2. the Employee shall have an opportunity to learn about both the Company and the position of employment;

        3. either party may terminate the employment relationship at any time during the initial 12-month period by giving 1 month advance written notice, in which case there will be no continuing obligations of the parties to each other, financial or otherwise.


      2. The decision to confirm or not to confirm the employment of the employee on completion of the probation period shall be the sole discretion of the Company and the decision of the Company in this regard shall be final and binding upon the Employee.


      3. The Company may, at its sole discretion, confirm or terminate the employment of the Employee even prior to Six

        (06) months.


    6. ANNUAL COMPENSATION (CTC)


      1. Salary: The Employee shall be paid an Annual CTC as mentioned in the Appointment letter dated «Date_», the breakup of which has been appended as Enclosure 1 to the Appointment letter.


      2. Reimbursement of approved expenses: The employee agrees that prior clearance will be obtained for travel and third-party costs if these are required to be incurred. Alternatively, the Company may make suitable arrangements for travel and other third-party services. The Employee agrees and understands that reimbursement and/or payments shall be against submission of supporting documents, invoices, vouchers, receipts, bills for the same at the end of the pre-decided schedule and in accordance with the Company’s policy and procedures.


      3. Taxes: All payments to be made to the Employee under this Agreement will be subject to required withholding of taxes as per the Income Tax Act or any other Act/rule/regulation applicable for the time being in force.


      4. Leaves: Employee shall be entitled to apply for leaves in accordance with the Leave policy framed by the Company.


      5. Increment and Bonus: Without any obligation to increase or otherwise change the compensation provision of this Agreement, the Company may at its sole discretion give annual increment and/or bonus on annual appraisal to the Employee based on the performance of the Employee. However, the employee agrees that increment or bonus shall not be a deemed right of the Employee and the decision of the Company in this regard shall be final and binding.


    7. EMPLOYEE'S LOYALTY TO COMPANY'S INTERESTS. The Employee shall devote all of his time, attention, knowledge, and skill solely and exclusively to the business and interests of the Company, and the Company shall be entitled to all benefits, emoluments, profits, or other issues arising from or incident to any and all work, services, and advice rendered by the Employee. The Employee expressly agrees that during the term hereof he will not be interested, directly or indirectly, in any form, fashion, or manner, as partner, officer, director, stockholder, advisor, employee, or in any other form or capacity, in any other business similar to the Company's business or any allied trade. Except that nothing herein contained shall be deemed to prevent or limit the right of employee to invest any of his surplus funds in the capital stock or other securities of any corporation whose stock or securities are publicly owned or are regularly traded on any public exchange, nor shall anything herein contained be deemed to prevent the Employee from investing or limit the Employee's right to invest his surplus funds in real estate.


    8. COVENANTS AND REPRESENTATIONS OF THE EMPLOYEE

      1. Confidentiality: Employee acknowledges that in the course of his employment by the Company, Employee will receive and or be in possession of confidential information of the Company and its affiliates. “Confidential Information” means any information, technical data or know-how (whether disclosed before or after the date of this Agreement), including, but not limited to, information relating to business and product or service plans, financial projections, customer lists, business forecasts, sales and merchandising, human resources, patents, patent applications, computer object or source code, research, inventions, processes, designs, drawings, engineering, marketing or finance, inventions, manufacturing processes, documentation, hardware configuration information, engineering data, marketing, notes, models, compositions, algorithms, software programs, software source documents, program schedule, visual demonstrations, photographs, manuscripts, texts, video recordings, formulations, equipment or apparatus, oral discussions, sales, marketing plans and/or financial information, cost estimates, pricing policy, to be confidential or proprietary and shall also include all such information would, under the circumstances, appear to a reasonable person to be confidential or proprietary.. Employee agrees that he will not, without the prior written consent of the Company, during the Term or thereafter, disclose or make use of any such confidential information, except as may be required by law or in the course of Employee's employment hereunder. Employee agrees that all tangible materials containing confidential information, whether created by Employee or others which shall come into Employee's custody or possession during Employee's employment shall be and is the exclusive property of the Company. Employee agrees not to use any Confidential Information disclosed to Employee by the Company for Employee’s own use or for any purpose, including for Employee’s commercial benefit or Company’s detriment, other than to undertaking the Services. Employee shall not disclose or permit disclosure of any Confidential Information of the Company to third parties. Employee agrees to take all reasonable measures to protect the secrecy of and avoid disclosure or use of Confidential Information of the Company in order to prevent it from falling into the public domain or the possession of persons other than those persons authorized under this Agreement to have any such information. Employee further agrees to notify the Company in writing of any actual or suspected misuse, misappropriation or unauthorized disclosure of the Company’s Confidential Information which may come to Employee’s attention. The Employee shall not use the Confidential Information of the Company to compete unfairly with or obtain unfair advantage over the Company in any commercial activity which may be comparable to the services contemplated by the parties under this Agreement; The Employee shall not, directly or indirectly copy, reproduce or duplicate, analyze, decompile or otherwise reverse engineer any tangible samples or materials comprising the Confidential Information of the Company. Employee agrees, except as otherwise expressly authorized by the Company, not to make any copies or duplicates of any the Company’s Confidential Information.


      2. Return of Confidential Information. Within Seven [7] days of (a) Company’s request or (b) determination of employment for any reason, the Employee shall return or destroy all Confidential Information disclosed/furnished to the Employee or which have come into his/her possession during the course of his services hereunder and all copies thereof in his/her possession in whatever form, at the choice of the Company, to be delivered in writing, and certify in writing that all copies thereof in his/her possession have been returned and/or destroyed. Upon written request from the Company, the Employee shall provide a signed, dated receipt which itemizes the Confidential Information transmitted or received hereunder.


      3. Non-Disparagement. During the Term and thereafter, Employee agrees not to disparage the Company or any of its affiliates or any of their respective directors, officers, employees, agents, representatives or licensees and not to publish or make any statement that is reasonably foreseeable to become public with respect to any of such entities or persons.

      4. Assignment of Intellectual property rights including but not limited to Copyrights, Inventions, etc. All intellectual property relating to the Business developed by the Employee shall be deemed to be in the course of employment and shall remain the exclusive property of the Company and the Employee shall not raise any claim or whatsoever in relation to such intellectual property. Any interest in patents, patent applications, inventions, technological innovations, copyrights, copyrightable works, developments, discoveries, designs, concepts, ideas and processes ("Such Inventions") that Employee now or hereafter during the Term may own or develop either individually or with other employees or the Company or with the clients of the Company shall solely belong to the Company or such affiliate and forthwith upon request of the Company, Employee shall execute all such assignments and other documents (including applications for patents, copyrights, trademarks and assignments thereof) and take all such other action as the Company may reasonably request in order to assign to and vest in the Company or its affiliates all of Employee's right, title and interest (including, without limitation, waivers to moral rights) in and to Such Inventions throughout the world, free and clear of liens, mortgages, security interests, pledges, charges and encumbrances.


      5. Employee acknowledges and agrees that (i) all copyrightable works created by Employee as an employee will be "works made for hire" on behalf of the Company and its affiliates and that the Company and its affiliates shall have all rights therein in perpetuity throughout the world and (ii) to the extent that any such works do not qualify as works made for hire, Employee irrevocably assigns and transfers to the Company and its affiliates all worldwide right, title and interest in and to such works. Employee hereby appoints any officer of the Company as Employee's duly authorized attorney-in-fact to execute, file, prosecute and protect Such Inventions before any governmental agency, court or authority. If for any reason the Company does not own any Such Invention, the Company and its affiliates shall have the exclusive and royalty-free right to use in their businesses, and to make products therefrom, Such Invention as well as any improvements or know-how related thereto.

      6. Remedy for Breach and Modification. Employee agrees that, in addition to any other relief or remedies available to the Company and its affiliates, the Company shall be entitled to seek an appropriate injunctive or other equitable remedy for the purposes of restraining Employee from any actual or threatened breach of or otherwise enforcing the provisions of this Agreement and no bond or security will be required in connection therewith.


      7. Ethical Considerations: The Employee undertakes to carry out his/her duties and responsibilities in full compliance with all applicable laws and relevant regulations, the Company's Code of Conduct, and generally recognized ethical and legal business standards. Any failure to adhere to ethical and legal business standards will subject an employee to disciplinary action, up to and including immediate termination of employment and revocation of the right to compensation under this Agreement.


    9. ASSUMPTION OF AGREEMENT BY COMPANY'S SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNEES. The Company's

      rights and obligations under this agreement will be binding upon the Company's successors and assignees.


    10. TERMINATION

      1. Termination with cause: The Company shall at any time have the right to terminate this Agreement and the Employee's employment with the Company for cause. For purposes of this Agreement, the term "cause" shall mean:


        1. Any breach of the Employee's obligations under this Agreement;

        2. Fraud, dishonesty, theft or gross misconduct and/or negligence on the part of the Employee, including, without limitation, conduct of criminal nature, conduct involving moral turpitude, embezzlement or misappropriation of assets;

        3. Use of drugs or intoxicants to an extent that it impairs the Employee's ability to perform his duties properly;

        4. Violation by the Employee of the Company’s Code of Conduct/HR Manual, his/her obligations to the Company, including, without limitation, conduct which is inconsistent with the Employee's position and which results or is reasonably likely to result in an adverse effect (financial or otherwise) on the business or reputation of the Company or any of its subsidiaries, divisions, or affiliates;

        5. The Employee's failure, refusal or neglect to perform his duties contemplated herein;

        6. Repeated violation by the Employee of any of the work rules or policies of the Company;

        7. Breach of standards adopted by the Company governing professional independence or conflicts of interest;

        8. Any other breach of the terms of this Agreement or the Company's policies as in effect from time to time that Employee has failed to cure within thirty (30) days following written notice of such breach from the Company to the Employee.


      2. If the employment of the Employee is terminated for cause, the Company shall not be obligated to make any further payment to the Employee (other than accrued and unpaid salary and commissions and expenses to the date of termination).


      3. Disability or Death:


        1. If, as the result of any physical or mental disability, the Employee shall have failed or is unable to perform his duties for a period of Sixty consecutive days, the Company may, by notice to the Employee subsequent thereto, terminate his employment under this Agreement as of the date of the notice without any further payment or the furnishing of any benefit by the Company under this Agreement (other than accrued and unpaid base salary and commissions and expenses).


        2. The term of the Employee's employment under this Agreement shall terminate upon his death without any further payment or the furnishing of any benefit by the Company under this Agreement (other than accrued and unpaid base salary, commissions and expenses).


      4. Termination without cause:

        The Company shall, without any cause whatsoever, at any time in its discretion, have the right to terminate the employment of the Employee and the Employee undertakes not to raise any dispute, claim, compensation etc. in this regard.


      5. Resignation from Employment by the Employee:

        1. The Employee agrees that in the event the Employee desires to resign from the employment, the employee shall be under an obligation to serve a «Notice_Period» months’ notice in advance to the Company or in case the Employee is unable to serve «Notice_Period» months’ notice in advance of his/her resignation, the Employee shall be liable to pay the Company, as compensation, a sum equivalent to the prevailing 2 months monthly compensation of the Employee.

        2. The Company's obligations to accept the resignation of the Employee shall be contingent upon (a) Employee delivering to the Company in writing releasing all claims against the Company and its affiliates and their respective directors, officers, employees, agents and representatives satisfactory in the form and content to the Company's counsel; (b) Employee having complied with the clauses relating to consequences of termination including but not limiting to return of intellectual property and confidential information, in whatever form etc; and (c) the Employee undertaking to continue compliance with his obligations under clause 12 of this Agreement.


      6. Discontinuance of Business as Termination of Employment: Anything herein contained to the contrary notwithstanding, in the event that Company shall discontinue its business operations mentioned above, then this agreement shall cease and terminate as of the last day of the month in which operations cease with the same force and effect as if such last day of the month were originally set forth as the termination date hereof.


    11. MISCELLANEOUS:

      1. Severability: If any provision of this Agreement is determined by a court or arbitrator to be void, invalid, illegal, excessively broad unreasonable or unenforceable in any respect, this determination shall not affect the validity of any other provision in this Agreement.


      2. Amendments: This Agreement may be changed, amended or otherwise modified only by an instrument in writing signed by duly authorised representatives of each Party to this Agreement, but where any such document exists and is so signed such Party shall not allege that such document is not binding by virtue of an absence of consideration.


      3. Waiver: Any failure or delay by any party to execute and/or implement any of its rights under this Agreement or under any applicable law, shall not be construed as a waiver of such rights and such Party shall be entitled to execute and/or implement these rights at any later date. No forbearance, failure, indulgence or relaxation of any Party at any time to require performance of any provision of this Agreement shall in any way affect, diminish or prejudice the right of such Party to require performance of the same provision at any future time or any other provisions at any time; Nor any waiver by any Party of any failure or breach of any provision of this Agreement shall be construed as a waiver of any continuing or succeeding breach of such provision, or a waiver or an amendment of the provision itself, or a waiver of any right under or arising out of this Agreement.


        No evidence of any waiver or modification shall be offered or received in evidence in any proceeding, arbitration, or litigation between the parties arising out of or affecting this agreement, or the rights or obligations of any party hereunder, unless such waiver or modification is in writing by both the Parties, duly executed as aforesaid. The provisions of this paragraph may not be waived except as herein mentioned.


      4. Survivorship: All obligations and duties hereunder which shall by their nature extend beyond the expiration or termination of this Agreement, shall survive and remain in effect beyond any expiration or termination hereof.


      5. Notices: All communications and notices required to be given shall be in writing to the address of the relevant party as set out in page 1 or the fax number/email address of the relevant party as set out below, or such other address or fax number/email ID as notified by the relevant party to the other from time to time, and shall be delivered either

        (i) by e-mail or facsimile transmission; (iii) by recognized courier service, or (iv) by registered mail, postage, speed post with proof of delivery. In the absence of evidence of earlier receipt, any notice or other, the communication shall be deemed to have been duly given, if delivered by registered mail, when delivered to the

        address referred to hereinabove, and if sent by fax, on receipt of confirmation of successful transmission; if delivered by courier, seven (7) Business Days after mailing the courier and if sent by email, on completion of delivery of email on the email-id given.


      6. Counterparts: This Agreement may be executed in two or more counterparts, each of which when so executed shall be deemed to be an original and all of which when taken together shall constitute one and the same instrument. The words “execution,” “signed,” “signature,” and words of like import in this Agreement or in any other certificate, agreement or document related to this Agreement, shall include images of manually executed signatures transmitted by facsimile or other electronic format (including, without limitation, “pdf”, “tif” or “jpg”) and other electronic signatures (including, without limitation, DocuSign and AdobeSign). The use of electronic signatures and electronic records (including, without limitation, any contract or other record created, generated, sent, communicated, received, or stored by electronic means) shall be of the same legal effect, validity and enforceability as a manually executed signature or use of a paper-based record-keeping system.


      7. Costs: Each of the Parties shall pay its respective legal, accounting and other professional Employeey fees, costs and expenses incurred in connection with the preparation, execution, negotiations and delivery of this Agreement.


      8. Headings: The headings used in this Agreement are for convenience only and are not to be used in construction or interpretation.


    12. DISPUTE RESOLUTION

      1. If any dispute arises between the parties in connection with the validity, interpretation, implementation or alleged breach of any provision of this agreement (a “Dispute”), the Parties shall endeavour to settle such dispute amicably. In the case of failure by the parties to resolve the dispute in the manner set out above within 30 (thirty) days from the date when the dispute arose, the dispute shall be referred to arbitration of a Sole Arbitrator to be appointed by the parties mutually. The venue and seat of arbitration shall be Ahmedabad. The arbitration proceeding shall be governed by Arbitration & Conciliation Act, 1996 or any statutory amendment/ modification or alteration thereof for the time being in force. The Arbitration proceedings shall be in the English language and the Arbitrator give reasons for the award, which shall be final and binding between the parties. The arbitration award shall be in writing.


      2. All materials in the proceedings created for the purpose of the arbitration, all other documents produced by another Party in the proceedings not otherwise in the public domain, and all awards in the arbitration will be deemed "Confidential Information", except to the extent disclosure may be required of a Party by legal duty to protect or pursue a legal right or to enforce or challenge an award in legal proceedings before a court or other judicial authority. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary above and irrespective of the tribunal's powers to order interim or conservatory measures, either Party may bring court proceedings in any court having jurisdiction as provided herein to seek an injunction, specific performance, or other equitable relief to enforce any right or obligation under this Agreement. Each Party agrees that its obligations hereunder are necessary and reasonable in order to protect the other Party and the other Party’s business, and expressly agrees that monetary damages would be inadequate to compensate the other Party for any breach by either Party of any covenants and agreements set forth herein. Accordingly, each Party agrees and acknowledges that any such violation or threatened violation will cause irreparable injury to the other Party and that, in addition to any other remedies that may be available, in law, in equity or otherwise, the other Party shall be entitled to obtain injunctive relief against the threatened breach of this Agreement or the continuation of any such breach, without any requirement

        to prove actual damages or that monetary damages are not an adequate remedy. If any claim or dispute arising out of or relating to this Agreement, including the breach, validity, interpretation and/or implementation of this Agreement (a “Dispute”) arises between the Parties that leads to arbitration or other proceeding to resolve such Dispute, then the prevailing Party in such proceeding shall be entitled to receive its attorneys' fees and costs incurred in connection with such proceeding in addition to any other relief as may be awarded.


    13. BENEFICIARY. The Employee shall be entitled, to the extent permitted under any applicable law, to select and change a beneficiary or beneficiaries to receive any compensation or benefit payable hereunder following the Employee's death by giving the Company written notice thereof. In the event of the Employee's death or a judicial determination of his incompetence, reference in this Agreement to the Employee shall be deemed, where appropriate, to refer to his beneficiary, state or other legal representative.


    14. REVIEW OF AGREEMENT. The Employee represents and agrees that Employee has carefully read and fully understands all of the provisions of this Agreement and that Employee voluntarily agrees to those provisions.


    15. GOVERNING LAW. This agreement and performance hereunder and all suits and special proceedings hereunder shall be construed in accordance with the laws of the India.


    16. JURISDICTION. The Parties hereby consent to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Ahmedabad for purposes of resolving any dispute under this Agreement.


    17. NON-TRANSFERABILITY. This Agreement is personal to the Employee and shall not be assigned or otherwise transferred in whole or in part to the other Party.


    18. BINDING EFFECT OF AGREEMENT. This agreement shall be binding on and inure to the benefit of the respective parties and their respective heirs, legal representatives, successors. Executed on the date first above written.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF the parties hereto have hereunto set their hands on the day and the year first above written.



With warm regards,

Mr. Japesh Jayadhevan (Chief Executive Officer) Authorized Signatory

For and on behalf of HOCCO INDUSTRIES PRIVATE LIMITED


                                                           (Employee Signature)
